result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher D Sutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge and restitution, to be paid out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Shawn O.
No contact with St. Camilla's nursing home. No contact with other nursing hours unless during normal business hours.

Random urine screens. No positive results.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Alcohol and drug assessment and MENTAL HEALTH assessment, and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.addlTxt: Telephone call from attorney Allison Ritter's office stating the return of property hearing scheduled on September 28, 2015 at 1:30 pm, can be removed from the calendar.  The Wauwatosa Police Department has been contacted and property has been returned.
Order and Notice of Hearing for return of property.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Petition for return of property.
Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 10/07/2014. dj

Defendant Christopher D Sutton in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PSI addressed; additions and corrections made.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $617.00 owed to St. Camilla Nursing Home and payable as a condition of probation.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 3 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months.
  
Conditions of ES:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and MENTAL HEALTH assessment, and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with Shawn O.
*No contact with St. Camilla's nursing home.  No contact with other nursing hours unless during normal business hours.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge and restitution, to be paid out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
-Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher D Sutton in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 2:  Dismissed and read-in
Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession / voting.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Court orders presentence investigation report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher D Sutton in court.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney unavailable, matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
